refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mysql_close closes the connection to the MySQL server that's associated with the specified link identifier. If link_identifier isn't specified, the last opened link is used.
Using mysql_close isn't usually necessary, as non-persistent open links are automatically closed at the end of the script's execution. See also freeing resources.

note.para: mysql_close will not close persistent links created by mysql_pconnect.

example.title: MySQL close example
example.programlisting:
<?php
    $link = mysql_connect("localhost", "mysql_user", "mysql_password")
        or die("Could not connect: " . mysql_error());
    echo "Connected successfully";
    mysql_close($link);
?>
